Package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful

package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful
Various utility classes for handling any of the color spaces, which are in subpackages of this one. FloatColors provides various methods that work for almost any color space, TrigTools provides the basic trigonometric approximations that lots of code here uses, and Shaders is a big repository of GLSL shader code meant to be used with SpriteBatch.
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.cielab
    CIELAB, the 1976 CIE L*A*B* color space.
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.hsluv
    HSLuv, a type of Hue, Saturation, Lightness color space with more even lightness.
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.ipt
    Color space code specialized for IPT.
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.ipt_hq
    Color space code specialized for IPT, Higher Quality version.
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab
    Oklab, the Okay-enough LAB color space.
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb
    Color space code specialized for RGB.
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.ycwcm
    Color space code specialized for YCwCm, a custom YCC color space.
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    FloatColors
    Various utility methods for working with colors encoded as packed floats in any of the formats this can use.
    Shaders
    Shader code to construct a ShaderProgram that can render the specialized colors produced by the rest of this library.
    TrigTools
    Various trigonometric approximations, using a lookup table for sin() and cos(), a non-tabular approximation for sinSmooth() and cosSmooth(), a Pad√© approximant for tan(), and Taylor series for the inverses of sin(), cos(), and tan().
